intro: Selliguea albidoglauca, commonly known as the white-blue liverwort, is a non-vascular plant belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, flattened thallus that often forms dense mats on moist, shaded rock surfaces. The plant exhibits a distinctive coloration, with a pale green to bluish-green hue due to its high chlorophyll content. It thrives in humid environments, typically found in temperate regions with high rainfall. Selliguea albidoglauca plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitats for various invertebrates.
